alert.note: Alert for Parker Valley (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 01 at 10:29PM MST until February 02 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM MST /7 AM PST/ TO 11 PM MST /10 PM PST/ WEDNESDAY... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /10 AM PST/ TO 8 PM MST /7 PM PST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust expected. * WHERE...In Arizona, Parker Valley. In California, Palo Verde Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 8 AM MST /7 AM PST/ to 11 PM MST /10 PM PST/ Wednesday. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, from 11 AM MST /10 AM PST/ to 8 PM MST /7 PM PST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing dust are possible with these wind speeds, particularly around open desert or freshly tilled fields. Diffused lofted dust is also possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep your foot off the brake pedal. Remember, pull aside, stay alive.
